0.title: Participation by a Few
0.description: In large lectures, only a few students speak. The rest just listen passively.

1.title: Superficial Opinions
1.description: Discussions with emotional claims without evidence. Lack of deep analysis and logical thinking.

2.title: Difficulty in Real-time Tracking
2.description: Impossible to check the thought process of 30 students individually. Hard to know who is struggling.

0.title: Simultaneous Participation
0.description: All students share their stances and evidence in real-time. No need to wait for a turn to speak.

1.title: AI-based Customized Discussion
1.description: AI asks 'Why do you think so?' to induce logical evidence writing. Deepens thinking.

2.title: Dashboard Monitoring
2.description: Grasp stance distribution, AI conversation status, and help requests at a glance. Intervene at the right time.

Features.title: Tools to Innovate Discussion
Features.description: Provides a smart discussion environment for both instructors and students.

0.title: Real-time Monitoring
0.description: Track student stance changes, AI conversation status, and evidence writing at a glance. Know immediately who needs help.

1.title: AI Socrates
1.description: AI asks students 'Why?'. Leads conversations that develop simple claims into logical grounds.

2.title: Stance Analysis
2.description: Visualize the distribution of pros/cons/neutral and key grounds for each stance. Read the flow of the discussion.

3.title: Instructor Intervention
3.description: Send hints, counterexamples, and encouragement at the right time. Deepen discussion with personalized feedback.

AiModes.title: Choose the AI that fits your class goal
AiModes.description: Instructors can directly set how to lead student thinking.
AiModes.note: You can select the AI mode when creating a discussion, and change it during the session.

socratic.label: Socratic Method
socratic.title: Questions Awakening the Unconscious
socratic.description: AI becomes a 'midwife' and draws out unconscious premises and beliefs hidden within the student. It persistently asks questions to explore fundamental values rather than superficial logic.

example.student: Laws must be strict for a just society.
example.ai: You believe strictness guarantees justice. Then, what is the essence of 'justice' you think of? Is it punishment or rehabilitation?

balanced.label: Balanced
balanced.title: Balanced Perspectives
balanced.description: Sympathizes with the student's opinion while gently introducing other perspectives. Helps explore various viewpoints without being biased.

example.student: I think working from home increases work efficiency.
example.ai: There are advantages such as improved concentration and saved commuting time. At the same time, what do you think about difficulties in team collaboration or onboarding new employees?

debate.label: Debate
debate.title: Argument with Sharp Counterarguments
debate.description: AI takes the role of 'Devil's Advocate' and actively argues against the student's claim. It digs into logical loopholes to stimulate the creation of stronger arguments.

example.student: Artificial intelligence will replace many jobs.
example.ai: But there were similar concerns during the Industrial Revolution, yet new job categories were created. What areas are difficult for AI to replace, and how would you explain historical precedents?

minimal.label: Minimal Intervention
minimal.title: Promoting Autonomous Thinking
minimal.description: AI only summarizes and confirms the student's remarks. Provides minimal intervention so students can organize and develop their thoughts on their own.

example.student: I think social media has a negative impact on teenagers.
example.ai: You gave an opinion on the negative impact of social media. do you have specific evidence to support this claim?

UseCases.description: Effective for all discussion classes, from philosophy to law.

0.title: Philosophy Class
0.description: Develop critical thinking through discussions on ethical dilemmas. Students view problems from various perspectives.

1.title: Business Case Study
1.description: Analyze real corporate cases and discuss decision-making. Improve data-based argumentation skills.

2.title: Law Mock Trial
2.description: Develop legal logic from pros/cons perspectives. Make persuasive arguments based on precedents and laws.

0.text: "After introducing Agora, student participation in discussions has noticeably increased. Since AI asks good questions, students also think more deeply."
0.author: Prof. Kim
0.affiliation: Seoul National University, Dept. of Philosophy

1.text: "AI pointed out the loopholes in my logic, so I thought more deeply. I was flustered at first, but thanks to it, I was able to make a much more solid argument."
1.author: Student Lee

2.text: "It is efficient to be able to grasp the participation of all students in real-time in a class of 30. I can know immediately who is having difficulties."
2.author: Prof. Park

0.question: Is Agora free?
0.answer: Yes, basic features are free to use. Consider the Pro plan if you need large-scale classes or advanced analysis features.

1.question: Does AI write answers for students?
1.answer: No. Agora's AI is not a simple chatbot. It is a 'discussion partner' that helps students develop their thoughts on their own by applying various educational methodologies such as the Socratic method and Devil's Advocate.

2.question: How many people can participate simultaneously?
2.answer: Up to 100 people can participate simultaneously per discussion. For large classes, we recommend dividing them into sections.

3.question: How is student data protected?
3.answer: All data is stored encrypted and strictly managed according to the privacy policy. Only the professor can access data from their own class.

4.question: Is integration with existing LMS possible?
4.answer: We are currently preparing integration with major LMS such as Moodle and Canvas. If you need integration, please contact us and we will support you with priority.

topic.title: Can Artificial Intelligence Replace Human Creativity?
topic.description: Discuss the advancements and limitations of AI in art, music, and writing. Explore the essence of creativity and the role of machines.

socratic.label: Socratic
socratic.preview: Interesting perspective. So what do you think is the essence of 'creativity'? Is it something only humans can possess?

balanced.label: Balanced
balanced.preview: There are various perspectives on AI creativity. Proponents point to new pattern generation, while critics argue the absence of true intention.

debate.label: Debate
debate.preview: That argument has logical gaps. How would you explain that AI has already created artworks that surpass human work?

minimal.label: Minimal
minimal.preview: Please proceed with your discussion freely. I'll ask questions when needed.

conversation.user: AI ultimately follows programmed patterns, so true creativity is impossible. Creativity stems from consciousness and emotion.
conversation.ai: Interesting perspective. Where do you think human creativity comes from? Don't humans also draw inspiration from patterns of experience and learning? If so, what is the essential difference between AI and human creative processes?

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy

purpose.title: 1. Purpose of Personal Information Processing
purpose.content: Agora processes personal information for the following purposes. The processed personal information will not be used for purposes other than the following, and necessary measures such as obtaining separate consent will be taken if the purpose of use changes.

items.3: Discussion activity analysis and feedback provision

items.title: 2. Personal Information Items Processed
items.content: The Company collects the following personal information for membership registration, service application, etc.

retention.title: 3. Destruction of Personal Information
retention.content: The Company destroys personal information without delay when the personal information becomes unnecessary, such as when the personal information retention period has elapsed or the processing purpose has been achieved.

Privacy.demoNote: * This Privacy Policy is an example written for demonstration purposes and has no actual legal effect.

Terms.title: Terms of Service

article1.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
article1.content: These Terms aim to prescribe the rights, obligations, and responsibilities between Agora (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and members in relation to the use of the online discussion platform service (hereinafter referred to as the "Service") provided by the Company.

article2.title: Article 2 (Definition)
article2.content1: 1. "Service" refers to Agora and related various services that members can use regardless of the terminal implemented (including various wired/wireless devices such as PCs and portable terminals).
article2.content2: 2. "Member" refers to a customer who accesses the Company's service, concludes a user agreement with the Company according to these Terms, and uses the service provided by the Company.

article3.title: Article 3 (Effect and Change of Terms)
article3.content: The Company posts the contents of these Terms on the initial screen of the service so that members can easily know. The Company may revise these Terms to the extent that it does not violate relevant laws such as the "Act on the Regulation of Terms and Conditions".

Terms.demoNote: * These Terms are an example written for demonstration purposes and has no actual legal effect.
